body:
Comment 4: 
I've moved my "$GOROOT" outside $GOPATH, but it still fails:

➜  ~  godoc -http=:8080 -analysis="type"
...
...
...
2014/09/18 19:26:19 Analysis failed: cannot find package "cmd" in any of:
	/home/pierre/Logiciels/go/src/pkg/cmd (from $GOROOT)
	/home/pierre/Go/src/cmd (from $GOPATH)

My Go installation is compiled from source.

I've updated/recompiled/reinstalled my $GOPATH with: go get -v -u ...

➜  ~  go version
go version go1.3.1 linux/amd64

➜  ~  echo $GOPATH
/home/pierre/Go

➜  ~  echo $GOROOT

➜  ~  ls $GOPATH
bin  pkg  src

➜  ~  go env
GOARCH="amd64"
GOBIN=""
GOCHAR="6"
GOEXE=""
GOHOSTARCH="amd64"
GOHOSTOS="linux"
GOOS="linux"
GOPATH="/home/pierre/Go"
GORACE=""
GOROOT="/home/pierre/Logiciels/go"
GOTOOLDIR="/home/pierre/Logiciels/go/pkg/tool/linux_amd64"
CC="gcc"
GOGCCFLAGS="-fPIC -m64 -pthread -fmessage-length=0"
CXX="g++"
CGO_ENABLED="1"
